channel.title: mediawiki skins
channel.description:
Medaiwiki skin: some websites look professionally, yet based on mediawiki. Possible to do with a skin.
[strapping](https://github.com/OSAS/strapping-mediawiki) is the mediawiki skin we are currently using for whonix.org mediawiki.
To get an idea what kind of customizations are doable...
default strapping skin: http://old.ovirt.org/Home
customized strapping skin: http://www.ovirt.org/
Perhaps there has been a [fork](https://github.com/axxie/strapping-mediawiki) of strapping. Perhaps the one who did the fork could modify and maintain the mediawiki skin changes for us.
Related:
* https://forums.whonix.org/t/new-qubes-website-new-whonix-website * https://forums.whonix.org/t/mediawiki-replacement

item.title: mediawiki skins
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
New theme / mediawiki skin(s) for Kicksecure documentation Website
GSoD 2019 project Since Kicksecure documentation will need to be identifiable from Whonix documentation a new theme will be found that will have a different theme and /or color palette. Related: https://forums.whonix.org/t/mediawiki-skins/2754/3 https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Category:All_skins

item.title: mediawiki skins
item.dc:creator: 0brand
item.description:
Combination or darker code block and bold text is a little overpowering in these steps IMO. They looked OK prior to new skins.

Easy fix is to remove bold type?

https://whonix.org/wiki/Tor#Regenerate_the_Tor_State_After_Saving_the_Tor_State_Folder

item.title: mediawiki skins
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
I think there is more space between lines then usual (compared with this forum for example). Too much.

torjunkie:

Tried that table formatting -> looks horrible. The current style is better.

Well, the code that I refereed wasn’t for usage. Only experimentation. there only shows two examples what’s possible. It should be possible to meld them when researching / experimenting enough / understanding enough of CSS. Maybe let’s post a new thread about this. CSS isn’t black magic and there might be someone in our community who knows that much.

https://phabricator.whonix.org/T809 updated.

Read full topic

item.title: mediawiki skins
item.dc:creator: torjunkie
item.description:
Patrick:

The space between lines is too big, but the space between paragraphs is too small, right?

Just the space between paragraphs.

Patrick:

Tables should be fixable. Just needs basic CSS knowledge, I think.

Tried that table formatting -> looks horrible. The current style is better.

Patrick:

Do you think there is too much space left and right on any wiki page?

Yes, agree with you on this.

Patrick:

Example?

Just seems to be the bullet points whenever used in footnotes e.g. footnote 76 and 104 here (it is replicated on all pages) ->

http://dds6qkxpwdeubwucdiaord2xgbbeyds25rbsgr73tbfpqpt4a6vjwsyd.onion/wiki/Comparison_with_Others

Patrick:

If not int hat task, unlikely will be fixed.

OK.

Read full topic

item.title: mediawiki skins
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Do you think there is too much space left and right on any wiki page? Or is just my minority preference? Same for the forums. I always wonder why not use most of the screen. Why put it in center and leave the rest free.

torjunkie:

Supersized font for bullet points in footer references.

Example?

torjunkie:

Supersized font for quotes in footer references.

Example?

Everything has to be in this task.
https://phabricator.whonix.org/T809
If not int hat task, unlikely will be fixed.

Read full topic

item.title: mediawiki skins
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
The space between lines is too big, but the space between paragraphs is too small, right?

Tables should be fixable. Just needs basic CSS knowledge, I think.

{| border="1" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px #aaa solid; border-collapse: collapse;"

vs

{| class="wikitable" style="background-color: #fff;text-align: center"

Read full topic

item.title: mediawiki skins
item.dc:creator: 0brand
item.description:
torjunkie:

(Minor) Table bordering and/or background is a little faint compared to previous versions. Probably fixable with wiki tags.

In some areas table bordering in non-existent like in this VPN table.

https://www.whonix.org/wiki/FAQ#Should_I_Install_a_VPN_on_the_Host_or_Whonix-Gateway.3F

Overall I really like the new skin.

Read full topic

item.title: mediawiki skins
item.dc:creator: torjunkie
item.description:
The other minor irritations are (which you probably noticed):

  • Supersized font for bullet points in footer references.
  • Supersized font for quotes in footer references.
  • (Minor) Table bordering and/or background is a little faint compared to previous versions. Probably fixable with wiki tags.

Read full topic

item.title: mediawiki skins
item.dc:creator: torjunkie
item.description:
Very sexy.

Takes the Whonix website from 1990s Netscape Navigator to maybe Firefox 40 something.

Only thing is what about the spacing between paragraphs? Seems a little tight. Maybe you can fix that with some master setting?

Read full topic

item.title: mediawiki skins

item.description:
The JavaScript and Expand/Collapse All loss are big downers.

v4 of Foundation is available now -> https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Skin:Foundation Better option?

item.title: mediawiki skins
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Replacing mediawiki skin strapping gets more pressing since it’s unmaintained and doesn’t work with next stable version of mediawiki.

Mediawiki skin foreground is maintained and looks good. Since there is no big supply of skins and no suggestions were made, let’s use foreground.

  • https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Skin:Foreground
  • https://github.com/thingles/foreground/
  • https://foreground.wikiproject.net/wiki/Sites_using_Foreground

Disadvantage is reliance on javascript, namely: The navbar (wiki header links HOME, DOWNLOAD, DOCS, HELP, NEWS)

github.com/jthingelstad/foreground

Issue: Clickable items in navigation without drop-down

opened by quimgil on 2014-09-07
closed by quimgil on 2014-09-07 
The drop-down items in the navigation bar are great, but is there a way to have plain clickable items, with no...
enhancement question

The expand all / collapse all buttons on https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Documentation may not work anymore.
(expand all at once button for wiki/Documentation)

…unless we find someone to fix these issues. Funding available.

Read full topic

item.title: mediawiki skins
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
• https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Category:All_skins
  • https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Category:Mobile_skins

foundationskin looks promising. However only with javascript enabled. Perhaps fixable. Perhaps this provider could be engaged.

https://foundationskin.org
( https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Skin:Foundation )

Foundation is currently unavailable to download, but will be back by 28th February 2018 … watch this space!

Read full topic
